setting.name: SOURCENUMBERMAPIP2TEL
setting.label: Source Number Map from IP to Tel
setting.description: Manipulate the source number for IP to Tel calls (see Audicodes documentation for details). When certain NI-2 protocol configured central offices require calling name to be disabled. Set this to: *,0,$$,$$,$$,$$,*,1,*

setting.name: REMOVECLIWHENRESTRICTED
setting.label: Remove CLI when restricted
setting.description: The Remove CLI when restricted (for IP to Tel calls) determines whether the Calling Number IE and Calling Name IE are removed from the outgoing ISDN Setup message if the presentation is set to Restricted. Typically used in certain NI-2 protocol enabled carriers.

setting.name: AssertedIDMode
setting.label: Asserted ID Mode
setting.description: The Asserted ID mode defines the header that is used in the generated INVITE request. The header also depends on the calling Privacy: allowed or restricted.

setting.name: LocalSIPPort
setting.label: UDP SIP Port
setting.description: UDP Port for SIP signaling

setting.name: TCPLocalSIPPort
setting.label: TCP SIP Port
setting.description: TCP Port for SIP signaling

setting.name: TLSLocalSIPPort
setting.label: TLS SIP Port
setting.description: TLS Port for SIP signaling

setting.name: IPAlertTimeout
setting.label: Tel to IP No Answer Timeout

option.label: Don't Include Number Plan and Type

setting.name: UseSourceNumberAsDisplayName
setting.label: Use Source Number as Display Name

setting.name: UseDisplayNameAsSourceNumber
setting.label: Use Display Name as Source Number

setting.name: SIPSDPSessionOwner
setting.label: SDP Session Owner
setting.description: The value of the Session Owner line ("o" field) in outgoing SDP bodies. May be up to 39 characters.

setting.name: 3xxBehavior
setting.description: Determines the gateway’s behavior when a 3xx response is received for an outgoing INVITE request. The gateway can either use the same call identifiers (CallID, branch, to and from tags) or change them in the new initiated INVITE. When enabled gateway will use the same call identifiers.

setting.name: EnablePChargingVector
setting.label: Enable P-Charging-Vector
setting.description: If checked, adds a P-Charging-Vector header to outgoing INVITE messages.

setting.name: EnableVMURI
setting.label: Enable Voicemail URI
setting.description: Enables or disables the interworking of target and cause for redirection from Tel to IP and vice versa, according to RFC 4468.

collection.name: CoderName
collection.description: List of preferred codecs in the order of priority

setting.name: IsFallbackUsed
setting.label: Enable Fallback to Internal Routing Table
setting.description: 0: Disable, 1: Enable fallback to internal routing tables

setting.name: PreferRouteTable
setting.label: Prefer Internal Routing Table
setting.description: 0: Disable, 1: Gateway checks the internal routing tables first. If not match, call is sent to Proxy.

setting.name: AlwaysSendToProxy
setting.label: Force All Messages to Proxy
setting.description: 0: Standard SIP call flow, 1: All messages and responses sent to proxy.

setting.name: SendInviteToProxy
setting.label: Send All INVITE to Proxy
setting.description: If disabled, INVITE messages resulting from redirect or transfer will be sent directrly to destination URI.

setting.name: IsRegisterNeeded
setting.label: Enable Registration
setting.description: 0: Don't register, 1: Register with proxy

setting.name: RegistrarIP
setting.label: Registrar IP Address
setting.description: Registrar's IP address

setting.name: SIPGatewayName
setting.label: Gateway Name
setting.description: Assign a name to the gateway. Ensure that the name you choose is the one that the Proxy is configured with to identify your media gateway.

setting.name: UseGatewayNameForOptions
setting.label: Gateway Name for OPTIONS
setting.description: The OPTIONS Request-URI host part contains either the gateway’s IP address or a string defined by the parameter ‘Gateway Name’.

setting.name: isProxyHotSwap
setting.label: Hot-Swap Redundancy Mode
setting.description: Enable or disable proxy hot-swap redundancy mode. This allows SIP INVITE/REGISTER messages to be routed to a redundant Proxy/Registrar server if the primary Proxy/Registrar server does not respond.

setting.name: HotSwapRtx
setting.label: Number of RTX before Hot-Swap
setting.description: The number of retransmitted INVITE messages before a call is routed (hot-swapped) to the next option. The valid range is 1 to 30.

setting.name: Cnonce
setting.label: CNONCE
setting.description: CNONCE

setting.name: SIPChallengeCachingMode
setting.label: Challenge Caching Mode

option.label: INVITE Only (challenges for INVITE requests are cached)

setting.description: To reduce the number of SIP messages, challenges can be cached. Select the desired level of challenge caching to use with SIP proxies.

setting.name: MutualAuthenticationMode
setting.label: Mutual Authentication Mode
setting.description: Select whether Authentication and Key Agreement (AKA) Digest Authentication information are optional or mandatory for incoming requests. If set to Mandatory, incoming requests without AKA information will be rejected.

setting.name: MaxDigits
setting.label: Dialed Digits Max. Length
setting.description: Maximum number of digits that can be dialed

setting.name: TimeBetweenDigits
setting.label: Inter-Digit Timeout
setting.description: Dial time out before end-of-dial recognized.

option.label: No declaration of RFC2833 in SDP

collection.name: TxDTMFOption
collection.label: Transmit DTMF Signaling Options
collection.description: Transmit DTMF options in order of priority

setting.name: RFC2833PayloadType
setting.label: RFC2833 DTMF Payload Type
setting.description: RFC 2833 DTMF Relay dynamic payload type. Allowed ranges are: 96 - 99 and 106 - 127

setting.name: DigitMapping
setting.label: Digit Map
setting.description: Digit map pattern. If the digit string (dialed number) has matched one of the patterns in the digit map, the gateway stops collecting digits and starts the call with the collected number. The digit map pattern contains up to 52 options separated by a vertical bar (|) and enclosed in parenthesis. The maximum length of the entire digit pattern is limited to 152 characters. Available notations: [n-m] represents a range of numbers ‘.’ single dot represents repetition ‘x’ represents any single digit ‘T’ represents a dial timer (configured by TimeBetweenDigits parameter) ‘S’ should be used when a specific rule, that is part of a general rule, is to be applied immediately. For example, if you enter the general rule x.T and the specific rule 11x, you should append ‘S’ to the specific rule 11xS. For example: (11xS|00T|[1-7]xxx|8xxxxxxx|#xxxxxxx|*xx|91xxxxxxxxxx|9011x.T)

setting.name: IsSpecialDigits
setting.label: Enable Special Digits
setting.description: Enable or disable the use of * and #

setting.name: MinFlashHookTime
setting.label: Minimal Period
setting.description: Minimal time (in milliseconds) for detection of a flash-hook event.

setting.name: FlashHookPeriod
setting.label: Maximal Period
setting.description: The maximal hook-flash detection period (for FXS gateways). A longer signal is considered offhook / onhook event.

setting.name: FlashHookPeriod
setting.label: Reported Period
setting.description: Flash-hook period (in milliseconds) that is reported to FXO port.

setting.name: SecureCallsFromIP
setting.label: Secure SIP Calls
setting.description: If enabled, gateways will only accept SIP calls from IP addresses listed below.

setting.name: AllowedIPs
setting.label: Accepted IP Addresses
setting.description: Space separated list of IP addresses from which gateway will accept the calls. It is taken into account only if Secure SIP Calls is enabled.

setting.name: EnableDigitDelivery
setting.label: Digit Delivery to Telephony Port
setting.description: Enables digit string to be played to the port at the far end, after off-hook.

setting.name: EnableDIDWink
setting.label: DID Wink Support
setting.description: When enabled, the gateway can connect to EIA/TIA 464B Loop Start DID lines. Both generation and detection supported.

setting.name: RegretTime
setting.label: Reanswer time
setting.description: The time period (in seconds) after user hangs up the phone and before call is disconnected. Also called regret time.

setting.name: DelayBeforeDIDWink
setting.label: Delay Before DID Wink
setting.description: Defines the time interval (in seconds) between detection of offhook and generation of DID Wink.

setting.name: EnableReversalPolarity
setting.label: Enable Call Disconnect on Polarity Reversal
setting.description: If checked, enable port disconnect (on-hook) based on polarity reversal.

setting.name: EnableCurrentDisconnect
setting.label: Enable Call Disconnect on Current Drop
setting.description: If checked, enable port disconnect (on-hook) based on current drop.

setting.name: DisconnectOnBrokenConnection
setting.label: Enable Call Disconnect on Broken Connection
setting.description: If checked, call is released if gateways stops receiving RTP for a period of time

setting.name: BrokenConnectionEventTimeout
setting.label: Broken Connection Timeout (10msec)
setting.description: Amount of time RTP is not received, after which call is cleared. In 10ms steps.

setting.name: EnableSilenceDisconnect
setting.label: Enable Call Disconnect on Far End Silence
setting.description: If checked, enable disconnection of call based on silence

setting.name: FarEndDisconnectSilencePeriod
setting.label: Silence Period for Disconnect
setting.description: Detection period, in seconds, before call is released based on silence

setting.name: FarEndDisconnectSilenceThreshold
setting.label: Silence Threshold
setting.description: Threshold of packet count, in percentage, below which is considered as silence.

setting.name: GwDebugLevel
setting.label: Detail Level in Debug Log
setting.description: Detail level of the log messages in syslog. Default is 0 (off), max is 5 (full)

setting.name: CDRSyslogServerIP
setting.label: CDR Server IP Address
setting.description: Optional separate Syslog server to collect CDRs only. If null and CDR is enabled, the output is mixed with the log messages and is routed to the Syslog server IP.

setting.name: EnableBusyOut
setting.label: Port Busy-Out Method
setting.description: 0: Disabled, 1: Telephony ports are busied out (special tone) in case of LAN failure, or Proxy communication failure.

setting.name: DefaultReleaseCause
setting.label: Default SIP Release Cause
setting.description: Default SIP release code.

setting.name: EnableSAS
setting.label: Enable SAS
setting.description: Enable/disable Stand-Alone Survivability

setting.name: SASLocalSIPUDPPort
setting.label: SAS Local SIP UDP port
setting.description: UDP Port for SAS SIP signaling

setting.name: SASDefaultGatewayIP
setting.label: SAS Default Gateway
setting.description: SAS Default Gateway

setting.name: EnableMWI
setting.label: Enable Message Waiting Indicator
setting.description: Enable/Disable Message Waiting Indication

setting.name: MWIAnalogLamp
setting.label: Enable analog MWI Lamp (!: high voltage)
setting.description: When enabled, the fxs gateway supplies 100Vdc to turn on the MWI lamp

setting.name: MWIDisplay
setting.label: Enable MWI Display
setting.description: When enabled, the fxs gateway generates FSK MSI message for telephone display

setting.name: EnableMWISubscription
setting.label: Enable MWI Subscription
setting.description: Disable/Enable SUBSCRIBE to MWI server.

setting.name: MWIServerIP
setting.label: MWI subscription Server IP Address
setting.description: MWI server IP address. If provided, the gateway subscribes to this IP address. Can be configured as a numerical IP address or as a domain name. If not configured, the Proxy IP address is used instead.

group.name: digital-trunk
group.label: E1/T1
group.description: E1/T1 trunk parameters shared by all trunks.

setting.name: PCMLawSelect
setting.label: PCM Law Select
setting.description: Usually A-Law is used for E1 spans and µ-Law for T1 and J1 spans

setting.name: TDMBusLocalReference
setting.label: TDM Bus Local Reference
setting.description: Trunk from which clock will be recovered.

option.label: Recover clock from Local Reference Only
Recover clock from any synchronized trunk

setting.name: PCMLawSelect
setting.label: PCM Law Select
setting.description: Usually A-Law is used for BRI

setting.name: TDMBusLocalReference
setting.label: TDM Bus Local Reference
setting.description: Trunk from which clock will be recovered.

option.label: Recover clock from Local Reference Only
Recover clock from any synchronized trunk

setting.name: DisconnectOnDialTone
setting.label: Enable Call Disconnect on Dial Tone

setting.name: DHCPEnable
setting.label: DHCP Enabled
setting.description: Disable/enable DHCP

setting.name: DisableNAT
setting.label: Static NAT Traversal Enabled
setting.description: Disable/enable static NAT traversal feature

setting.name: STATICNATIP
setting.label: Public Address for NAT
setting.description: IP address of the gateway as seen from the outside of NAT

setting.name: DNSPriServerIP
setting.label: Primary DNS Server
setting.description: Primary DNS server

setting.name: DNSSecServerIP
setting.label: Secondary DNS Server
setting.description: Secondary DNS server

setting.name: NTPServerIP
setting.label: NTP Server IP Address
setting.description: NTP Server to sync time/date with

setting.name: NTPServerUTCOffset
setting.label: NTP UTC Offset (hours)
setting.description: Offset from UTC

setting.name: NTPUpdateInterval
setting.label: NTP Update Interval (sec)
setting.description: NTP update interval, in seconds

setting.name: ENABLESTUN
setting.label: STUN Enabled
setting.description: Enable/disable STUN

setting.name: STUNSERVERPRIMARYIP
setting.label: Primary STUN Server IP Address
setting.description: IP address of the primary STUN server

setting.name: STUNSERVERSECONDARYIP
setting.label: Secondary STUN Server IP Address
setting.description: IP address of the secondary STUN server

setting.name: EnablePPPoE
setting.label: PPPoE Enabled
setting.description: Enable/disable PPPoE

setting.name: PPPoEUserName
setting.label: PPPoE User Name
setting.description: PPPoE user name

setting.name: PPPoEPassword
setting.label: PPPoE Password
setting.description: PPPoE password

setting.name: PPPoEServerName
setting.label: PPPoE Server Name
setting.description: PPPoE server name

setting.name: PPPoEStaticIPAddress
setting.label: PPPoE Requested IP Address
setting.description: PPPoE Static IP address to be requested from PPPoE server

setting.name: PPPoERecoverIPAddress
setting.label: PPPoE Recovery IP Address
setting.description: IP address to use when IP address negotiation/assignment fails in PPPoE mode.

setting.name: PPPoERecoverSubnetMask
setting.label: PPPoE Recovery Subnet Mask
setting.description: Subnet mask to use when IP address negotiation/assignment fails in PPPoE mode.

setting.name: PPPoERecoverDfgwAddress
setting.label: PPPoE Recovery Default Gateway
setting.description: Default gateway to use when IP address negotiation/assignment fails in PPPoE mode.

setting.name: EnableSyslog
setting.label: Syslog Output Enabled
setting.description: Enable/disable Syslog facility for diagnostics

setting.name: SyslogServerIP
setting.label: Syslog Server IP address
setting.description: The IP address of the Syslog server

setting.name: SyslogServerPort
setting.label: Syslog Server Port
setting.description: Default syslog port

setting.name: InputGain
setting.label: PCM Input Gain Control
setting.description: Voice gain control Tel-to-IP direction

option.label: Erase digit from voice stream, realy as RFC2833

setting.name: DTMFVolume
setting.label: DTMF Volume
setting.description: DTMF gain control value in dB (to the analog side)

setting.name: FaxModemBypassCoderType
setting.label: Fax Transport Codec in By-Pass Mode

setting.name: FaxBypassPayloadType
setting.label: Fax Transport Payload ID in By-Pass Mode
setting.description: Payload type for by-pass fax transport, 96 thru 120

setting.name: FaxRelayRedundancyDepth
setting.label: Fax Relay Redundancy Depth
setting.description: Number of times that each fax relay payload is retransmitted to the network

setting.name: FaxRelayEnhancedRedundancyDepth
setting.label: Fax Relay Enhanced Redundancy Depth
setting.description: Number of times that control packets are retransmitted when using the T.38 standard

setting.name: FaxRelayMaxRate
setting.label: Fax Relay Max Rate
setting.description: Maximum rate at which fax relay messages are transmitted (outgoing calls)

setting.name: FaxModemBypassM
setting.label: Fax/Modem Bypass Packing Factor
setting.description: Number of (20 msec) coder payloads that are used to generate a fax/modem bypass packet.

setting.name: CNGDetectorMode
setting.label: CNG Detector Mode
setting.description: In Relay mode, CNG is detected on the originating side. CNG packets are sent to the remote side according to T.38 and the fax session is started. In Events Only mode, CNG is detected on the originating side. The CNG signal passes transparently to the remote side and fax session is started.

setting.name: EnableCallerID
setting.label: Enable Caller ID
setting.description: Enable generation (FXS) and detection (FXO) of Caller ID on the telephony ports

setting.name: DJBufMinDelay
setting.label: Jitter Buffer Minimum Delay
setting.description: Jitter buffer minimum delay, in milliseconds

setting.name: DJBufOptFactor
setting.label: Jitter Buffer Optimization Factor
setting.description: Jitter buffer optimization factor.

setting.name: RTPRedundancyDepth
setting.label: RTP Redundancy Depth
setting.description: Generation of RFC 2198 redundancy packets.

setting.name: RFC2198PayloadType
setting.label: RFC 2198 Payload
setting.description: Applicable only if RTP Redundancy Depth is enabled

setting.name: EnableStandardSIDPayloadType
setting.label: RFC 3389 CN Payload
setting.description: If Enabled SID (comfort noise) packets are sent with the RTP SID payload type according to RFC 3389. Applicable to G.711 and G.726 coders. Otherwise proprietaty method is used.

setting.name: BaseUDPPort
setting.label: Base UDP/RTP Port
setting.description: Base UDP port for RTP

setting.name: CallProgressTonesFilename
setting.label: Call Progress Tones Filename
setting.description: Call progress tones definition filename, to be TFTP-loaded during boot

setting.name: FXSLoopCharacteristicsFilename
setting.label: FXS Loop Characteristics Filename
setting.description: FXS loop characteristics definition filename, to be TFTP-loaded during boot

setting.name: CountryCoefficients
setting.label: Country Variant
setting.description: country variant for line characteristics. North America = 70

option.label: Power down or ethernet link down
Power down or ethernet link down or network down

setting.name: SNMPManagerIsUsed_0
setting.label: Enable SNMP
setting.description: Enable/disable external SNMP manager to receive alarms/traps

setting.name: SNMPManagerTableIP_0
setting.label: SNMP Manager IP Address
setting.description: External SNMP Manager IP address

setting.name: SNMPPort
setting.label: SNMP Port
setting.description: Default port

setting.name: SNMPManagerTrapPort
setting.label: SNMP Trap Port
setting.description: Default trap port

setting.name: SNMPManagerTrapSendingEnable
setting.label: Enable SNMP Trap Sending
setting.description: Enable/disable sending traps to external SNMP manager

setting.name: SNMPTRUSTEDMGR_0
setting.label: SNMP Trusted Manager for Configuration
setting.description: Enable/disable SNMP-based configuration control, and manager IP

setting.name: SNMPREADONLYCOMMUNITYSTRING_0
setting.label: Read-Only Community String
setting.description: Read-Only Community String

setting.name: SNMPREADWRITECOMMUNITYSTRING_0
setting.label: Read-Write Community String
setting.description: Read-Write Community String

setting.name: SNMPTRAPCOMMUNITYSTRING
setting.label: Trap Community string
setting.description: Trap community string
